bakeoff 0.1.0.9000
  • Reference
  • News

Reference

Joined tibbles

Tame and tidy data resulting from joining simple tibbles (below), based on shared units of observation.

baker_results

Each baker's statistics

episode_results

Each episodes' statistics

challenge_results

Each baker's signature, technical, and showstopper challenges, plus their fate, by episode

ratings_seasons

Each episode's ratings plus original airdates in the UK (by series) and US (by season)

Simple tibbles

Tibbles with data from Wikipedia, followed by minimal taming using the fivethirtyeight R data package guidelines. All variable types are cast properly, all tibbles are in tidy format, and all variable names are in snake_case.

bakers

Each baker's name, age, occupation, and hometown

episodes

Each baker's signature, technical, and showstopper challenges, by episode

ratings

Each episode's ratings

results

Each baker's fate, by episode

series

Overview of each series aired in the UK

seasons

Seasons and airdates for the US version called 'The Great British Baking Show'

Scales

Color and fill scales

bakeoff_colors()

Extract named bakeoff colors as hex codes

bakeoff_palette()

A bakeoff palette generator

scale_color_bakeoff() scale_fill_bakeoff()

Color scale constructor for bakeoff colors

bakeoff_color_data

Define hex codes for named bakeoff colors

bakeoff_generate_pal()

Return function that creates a bakeoff color palette Mainly useful for creating ggplot2 scales

bakeoff_palette_names()

Print names of all bakeoff color palettes

bakeoff_palettes

Define bakeoff color palettes from named colors
